|Title=Knowing the complication to detect before stopping anticoagulant treatment for PE
|Description=None
|Topic=Follow-up and/or prognosis
|Contributors=Gilles Pernod, Virginie Dufrost, Guillaume Mahé
|Order=17}}
Before stopping the anticoagulant treatment prescribed for PE, it is important to ensure that there is no [[Dyspnoea SD-162|dyspnoea]]. In the event of dyspnoea, it is essential to detect [[https://sides.uness.fr/lisa/Savoir_%C3%A9voquer_les_complications_%C3%A0_long_terme_de_la_MTEV_(post-thrombotic_syndrome,_HTAP)_2C-226-SP-B01 post-embolic pulmonary hypertension (PH)] by first performing a transthoracic Doppler cardiac ultrasound.
----

question.title: Before stopping anticoagulant treatment for PE, it is essential to detect which complication first?

option_a.title: Post-embolic pulmonary hypertension (PH)
option_a.description: A condition that can occur after a pulmonary embolism, characterized by high blood pressure in the lungs

option_b.title: Dyspnoea
option_b.description: Shortness of breath, a common symptom of heart or lung disease
